    • Method Detail

      • attemptInitializeGame

        boolean attemptInitializeGame​(int noOfInitialNodes)
                       throws NumberOfInitialNodesException
        Adds initial nodes to the game if the input number of nodes are within bounds
        Parameters:
        noOfInitialNodes - : Number of initial nods\
        Returns:
        true if initialization exceeded
        Throws:
        NumberOfInitialNodesException - if the number of nodes are out of bounds

      • attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes

        boolean attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes​(int startNodeName,
                                    int endNodeName)
                             throws IllegalNodesChosenException,
                                    CollisionException,
                                    NoValidEdgeException,
                                    InvalidPath,
                                    GameEndedException
        Initializes the drawing of a new edge if the nodes chosen exist in the game Used in strict mode.
        Parameters:
        startNodeName - : Name of start node
        endNodeName - : Name of end node
        Returns:
        true if the new edge is valid
        Throws:
        IllegalNodesChosenException - if the nodes chosen are not in the game
        CollisionException - if the new edge is a line or circle, and collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        NoValidEdgeException - if the is no valid edge between the chosen nodes
        InvalidPath - if the new edge is a drawn path, and collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        GameEndedException - if the edge is valid, and there are no valid moves left on the gameboard

      • attemptDrawSmartEdgeBetweenNodes

        boolean attemptDrawSmartEdgeBetweenNodes​(int startNodeName,
                                         int endNodeName)
                                  throws IllegalNodesChosenException,
                                         NoValidEdgeException,
                                         InvalidPath,
                                         GameEndedException
        Initializes the drawing of a new edge if the nodes chosen exist in the game. Used in dynamic mode.
        Parameters:
        startNodeName -
        endNodeName -
        Returns:
        true if the new edge is valid
        Throws:
        IllegalNodesChosenException - if the nodes chosen are not in the game
        NoValidEdgeException - if the is no valid edge between the chosen nodes
        InvalidPath - if the new edge collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        GameEndedException - if the edge is valid, and there are no valid moves left on the gameboard

        This method tells the model to initialize the path/drawing.

      • beginDrawing

        void beginDrawing​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseDragged)
           throws InvalidPath,
                  CollisionException,
                  PathForcedToEnd
        This method communicates to the model's drawPath method that a drawing has started
        Parameters:
        mouseDragged - The mousedrag that begins the drawing
        Throws:
        InvalidPath
        CollisionException
        PathForcedToEnd

      • completeDrawing

        void completeDrawing​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
              throws InvalidNode,
                     InvalidPath,
                     GameEndedException
        This method let's the model's finishPath method know that the path should now end.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The last mouseevent that ends the drawing.
        Throws:
        InvalidNode
        InvalidPath
        GameEndedException

      • isCollided

        boolean isCollided()
        This method let's the gameController know if a collision has occurred by letting the sproutController ask the model.

      • attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes

        public void attemptDrawEdgeBetweenNodes​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle startNode,
                                        javafx.scene.shape.Circle endNode)
                                 throws IllegalNodesChosenException,
                                        CollisionException,
                                        NoValidEdgeException,
                                        InvalidPath,
                                        GameEndedException
        Initializes the drawing of a new edge if the nodes chosen are eligible Used in strict mode.
        Parameters:
        startNode - : Start node shape
        endNode - : End node shape
        Throws:
        IllegalNodesChosenException - if the nodes chosen are not in the game
        CollisionException - if the new edge collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        NoValidEdgeException - if the is no valid edge between the chosen nodes
        GameEndedException - if the edge is drawn, and there are no valid moves left on the gameboard
        InvalidPath

      • attemptDrawSmartEdgeBetweenNodes

        void attemptDrawSmartEdgeBetweenNodes​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle startNode,
                                      javafx.scene.shape.Circle endNode)
                               throws IllegalNodesChosenException,
                                      NoValidEdgeException,
                                      InvalidPath,
                                      GameEndedException
        Initializes the drawing of a new edge if the nodes chosen are eligible Used in dynamic mode.
        Parameters:
        startNode - : Start node shape
        endNode - : End node shape
        Throws:
        IllegalNodesChosenException - if the nodes chosen are not in the game
        NoValidEdgeException - if the is no valid edge between the chosen nodes
        InvalidPath - if the new edge collides with existing edges, nodes or the canvas frame
        GameEndedException - if the edge is valid, and there are no valid moves left on the gameboard

                              throws IllegalNodesChosenException
        Checks if one or both of the chosen nodes are not in the game or has 3 connecting edges

        endNode -
        Throws:

      • getIllegalEdgeBetweenNodes

        javafx.scene.shape.Shape getIllegalEdgeBetweenNodes​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle startNode,
                                                    javafx.scene.shape.Circle endNode)
        As the creating of en edge is terminated once it is deemed illegal, this method is used to get create the illegal edge, so that it can be drawn (in red) in the canvas. The method wont invoke collision checks.
        Parameters:
        startNode - Start node chosen
        endNode - End node chosen
        Returns:
        the illegal edge

      • getCurrentPlayerName

        java.lang.String getCurrentPlayerName()
        Retrieves the name of the current player from the GameFlow class
        Returns:
        the name of the current player

        Node getNodeFromCircle​(javafx.scene.shape.Circle circle)
        Retrieves node ID given a node shape
        Parameters:
        circle - : a circle shape belonging to a node
        Returns:
        a node ID
